scenes.scene_description: Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe is there.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi guys!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey, Pheebs! Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey. Oh, oh, how'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, not so good. He walked me to the subway and said 'We should do this again!'

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Ohh. Ouch.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What? He said 'we should do it again', that's good, right?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, no. Loosely translated 'We should do this again' means 'You will never see me naked'.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Since when?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Since always. It's like dating language. Y'know, like 'It's not you' means 'It is you'.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Or 'You're such a nice guy' means 'I'm gonna be dating leather-wearing alcoholics and complaining about them to you'.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Or, or, y'know, um, 'I think we should see other people' means 'Ha, ha, I already am'.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And everybody knows this?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah. Cushions the blow.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's like when you're a kid, and your parents put your dog to sleep, and they tell you it went off to live on some farm.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's funny, that, no, because, uh, our parents actually did, uh, send our dog off to live on a farm.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? Wh- hello? The Millners' farm in Connecticut? The Millners, they had this unbelievable farm, they had horses, and, and rabbits that he could chase and it was- it w- .....Oh my God, Chi Chi!

scenes.event_description: Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe is there.

events.event_description: Phoebe enters Central Perk and greets everyone.
Ross asks Phoebe how her date went.
Phoebe reports that her date did not go well and that her date said 'We should do this again!'.
Chandler comments on the meaning of 'We should do this again!'.
Rachel questions the positive interpretation of her date's statement.
Monica explains the negative connotation of 'We should do this again' to Rachel.
Joey explains that dating language often cushions the blow of rejection.
Chandler humorously compares polite rejection to a child's explanation about a dog going to a farm.
Ross shares that his parents actually sent their dog to a farm, confirming the story's plausibility.
Ross realizes that the Millners' farm in Connecticut was the actual destination of his family's dog, Chi Chi.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is helping Joey rehearse for a part.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: "So how does it feel knowing you're about to die?"

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: "Warden, in five minutes my pain will be over. But you'll have to live with the knowledge that you sent an honest man to die."

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, that was really good!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thanks! Let's keep going.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay. "So. Whaddya want from me, Damone, huh?"

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: "I just wanna go back to my cell. 'Cause in my cell, I can smoke."

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: "Smoke away."

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I think this is probably why Damone smokes in his cell alone.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Relax your hand!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Not so much!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoah!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright, now try taking a puff.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright.. okay. No. Give it to me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No no no, I am not giving you a cigarette.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It's fine, it's fine. Look, do you wanna get this part, or not? Here.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Don't think of it as a cigarette. Think of it as the thing that's been missing from your hand. When you're holding it, you feel right. You feel complete.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Y'miss it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nah, not so much. Alright, now we smoke. (Takes a puff.) Oh.. my.. God. (He continues to smoke.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is helping Joey rehearse for a part.]

events.event_description: Chandler asks Joey how it feels knowing he's about to die.
Joey responds to Chandler, claiming that in five minutes his pain will be over and that Chandler will have to live with the guilt.
Chandler compliments Joey on his performance.
Joey expresses willingness to continue rehearsing.
Chandler prompts Joey to say a line from the scene, asking 'Whaddya want from me, Damone?'
Joey responds with his line about wanting to go back to his cell to smoke.
Chandler encourages Joey to smoke, saying 'Smoke away.'
Chandler comments on why Damone might smoke alone in his cell.
Chandler instructs Joey to relax his hand and not to squeeze the cigarette too tightly.
Chandler takes a puff from the cigarette, exclaims 'Oh.. my.. God.', and continues to smoke.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe and Rachel is there.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, no, no. They say it's the same as the distance from the tip of a guy's thumb to the tip of his index finger.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That's ridiculous!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Can I use.. either thumb?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (carrying a tray of drinks) Alright, don't tell me, don't tell me! (Starts handing them out.) Decaf cappucino for Joey.. Coffee black.. Late.. And an iced tea. I'm getting pretty good at this!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah, excellent.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (leaving to serve others) Good for me!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Y'okay, Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah- no- I'm just- it's, I haven't worked- It's my bank.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What did they do to you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It's nothing, it's just- Okay. I'm going through my mail, and I open up their monthly, you know, STATEMENT-

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Easy.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: - and there's five hundred extra dollars in my account.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, Satan's minions at work again...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, 'cause now I have to go down there, and deal with them.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are you talking about? Keep it!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It's not mine, I didn't earn it, if I kept it, it would be like stealing.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, but if you spent it, it would be like shopping!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. Okay, let's say I bought a really great pair of shoes. Do you know what I'd hear, with every step I took? 'Not-mine. Not-mine. Not-mine.' And even if I was happy, okay, and, and skipping- 'Not-not-mine, not-not-mine, not-not-mine, not-not-mine'...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We're with you. We got it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. I'd- just- I'd never be able to enjoy it. It would be like this giant karmic debt.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Chandler, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (puling him up) Hey. Whaddya doing?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh! Oh, God!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What is this?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm smoking. I'm smoking, I'm smoking.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I can't believe you! You've been so good, for three years!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And this- is my reward!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hold on a second, alright? Just think about what you went through the last time you quit.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, so this time I won't quit!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Ohhh! Put it out!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right! I'm putting it out, I'm putting it out. (He drops it in Phoebe's coffee.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, no! I- I can't drink this now!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright. I'm gonna go change, I've got a date.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: This Alan again? How's it goin'?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: 'S'going pretty good, y'know? It's nice, and, we're having fun.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So when do we get to meet the guy?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Let's see, today's Monday... Never.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, come on! Come on!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No. Not after what happened with Steve.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What are you talking about? We love Schhteve! Schhteve was schhexy!.. Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look, I don't even know how I feel about him yet. Just give me a chance to figure that out.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, then can we meet him?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Nope. Schhorry.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe and Rachel is there.]

events.event_description: Monica explains the distance from the tip of a guy's thumb to his index finger as a way to measure something.
Joey expresses disbelief at Monica's explanation.
Ross asks if he can use either thumb to measure.
Rachel carries a tray of drinks and begins serving customers.
Phoebe discusses discovering an unexpected five hundred dollars in her bank account.
Chandler jokes about Satan's minions being responsible for Phoebe's bank statement discrepancy.
Chandler smokes a cigarette and drops it into Phoebe's coffee, causing her concern.
Monica announces she is going to change clothes because she has a date.
Rachel inquires about Monica's date with Alan and comments on her progress.
Monica declines to introduce her date to the group, citing past experiences with Steve.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Iridium, Monica and Paula are at work.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I mean, why should I let them meet him? I mean, I bring a guy home, and within five minutes they're all over him. I mean, they're like- coyotes, picking off the weak members of the herd.

dialogue.speaker: PAULA
dialogue.text: Listen. As someone who's seen more than her fair share of bad beef,

dialogue.speaker: PAULA
dialogue.text:
I'LL
TELL YOU that is not such a terrible thing. I mean, they're your friends, they're just looking out after you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know. I just wish that once, I'd bring a guy home that they actually liked.

dialogue.speaker: PAULA
dialogue.text: Well, you do realise the odds of that happening are a little slimmer if they never get to meet the guy..

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Iridium, Monica and Paula are at work.]

events.event_description: Monica questions why she should let her friends meet her date, expressing concern about their behavior.
Monica describes her friends as coyotes, metaphorically suggesting they pick off the weak members of the herd.
Paula advises Monica that her friends are just looking out for her and implies that meeting her date is not a bad thing.
Monica expresses her wish that her friends would like the guy she brings home.
Paula comments that the chances of Monica's friends liking her date are slim if they never meet him.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is smoking out on the balcony, Phoebe is absent.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Let it go, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, you didn't know Chi Chi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you all promise?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah! We promise! We'll be good!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (shouts to Chandler) Chandler? Do you promise to be good?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You can come in, but your filter-tipped little buddy has to stay outside!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, Pheebs.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: 'Dear Ms. Buffay. Thank you for calling attention to our error. We have credited your account with five hundred dollars. We're sorry for the inconvenience, and hope you'll accept this- (Searches in her purse) - football phone as our free gift.' Do you believe this?! Now I have a thousand dollars, and a football phone!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What bank is this?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey. It's him. (On the intercom) Who is it?

dialogue.speaker: ALAN
dialogue.text: (on the intercom) It's Alan.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (shouting to Chandler) Chandler! He's here!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to all) Okay, please be good, please . Just remember how much you all like me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi. Alan, this is everybody. Everybody, this is Alan.

dialogue.speaker: ALAN
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hi, Alan.

dialogue.speaker: ALAN
dialogue.text: I've heard schho much about all you guyschh!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Alan) Thanks. I'll call you tomorrow. (Alan exits, to all) Okay. Okay, let's let the Alan-bashing begin. Who's gonna take the first shot, hmm?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: C'mon!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...I'll go. Let's start with the way he kept picking at- no, I'm sorry, I can't do this, can't do this. We loved him.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Loved him! Yeah! He's great!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wait a minute! We're talking about someone that I'm going out with?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And did you notice...? (She spreads her thumb and index finger.)

dialogue.speaker: THE GUYS
dialogue.text: (reluctantly) Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Know what was great? The way his smile was kinda crooked.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, yes! Like the man in the shoe!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...What shoe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: From the nursery rhyme. 'There was a crooked man, Who had a crooked smile, Who lived in a shoe, For a... while...'

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ...So I think Alan will become the yardstick against which all future boyfriends will be measured.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What future boyfriends? Nono, I th- I think this could be, y'know, it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. I'd marry him just for his David Hasselhof impression alone. You know I'm gonna be doing that at parties, right? (Does the impression)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You know what I like most about him, though?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The way he makes me feel about myself.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah...

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is smoking out on the balcony, Phoebe is absent.]

events.event_description: Monica asks all characters to promise they will be good during the visit.
Joey tells Ross to let go of his concerns about Chi Chi.
Phoebe receives a credit of five hundred dollars from her bank after calling attention to an error.
Alan arrives at Monica and Rachel's apartment and is announced over the intercom.
Monica introduces Alan to all characters present.
Ross expresses that he loved Alan, despite his previous criticisms.
The group agrees that Alan is a great person and liked by all.
Monica reveals she is dating Alan and questions if she is surprised about it.
Chandler jokes about marrying Alan for his David Hasselhof impression and performs the impression.
Ross states that he appreciates Alan for how he makes him feel about himself.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Monica is alone as Ross, Rachel, Chandler, and Joey enter
dejectedly in softball gear.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.. how was the game?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well..

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: WE WON!! Thank you! Yes!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Fantastic!

dialogue.speaker: I HAVE ONE QUESTION
dialogue.text: How is that possible?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alan.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He was unbelievable. He was like that-that-that Bugs Bunny cartoon where Bugs is playing all the positions, right, but instead of Bugs it was first base-Alan, second base-Alan, third base-...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I mean, it-it was like, it was like he made us into a team.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yep, we sure showed those Hassidic jewellers a thing or two about softball..

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Can I ask you guys a question? D'you ever think that Alan is maybe.. sometimes..

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ..I dunno, a little too Alan?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, no. That's impossible. You can never be too Alan.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's his, uh, innate Alan-ness that-that-that we adore.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I personally could have a gallon of Alan.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Monica is alone as Ross, Rachel, Chandler, and Joey enter
dejectedly in softball gear.]

events.event_description: Ross, Rachel, Chandler, and Joey enter Central Perk wearing softball gear and appear dejected.
Ross exclaims that they won the game and thanks someone.
Monica asks the group how the game was.
Ross describes Alan's performance in the game, comparing him to a Bugs Bunny cartoon and explaining he played all positions.
Rachel comments that Alan made the team feel unified.
Chandler makes a humorous remark about showing the Hassidic jewelers a thing or two about softball.
Monica questions whether Alan is sometimes 'too Alan'.
Rachel responds that it's impossible to be 'too Alan', implying admiration for Alan's qualities.
Ross agrees that Alan's innate qualities are what they adore.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A street, Phoebe walks up to a homeless person (Lizzie) she knows.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, Lizzie.

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: Hey, Weird Girl.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I brought you alphabet soup.

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: Did you pick out the vowels?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes. But I left in the Ys. 'Cause, y'know, "sometimes y". Uh, I also have something else for you. (She searches in her purse.)

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: Saltines?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, but would you like a thousand dollars and a football phone?

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: What? (She opens the envelope Phoebe has given her.) Oh my God, there's really money in here.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: Weird Girl, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I want you to have it. I don't want it.

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: No, no, I ha-I have to give you something.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, that's fine, no.

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: Would you like my tin-foil hat?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No. 'Cause you need that. No, it's okay, thanks.

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: Please, let me do something.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, alright, you buy me a soda, and then we're even. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A street, Phoebe walks up to a homeless person (Lizzie) she knows.]

events.event_description: Phoebe approaches Lizzie on the street and greets her.
Phoebe gives Lizzie a container of alphabet soup.
Lizzie asks if Phoebe picked out the vowels from the soup.
Phoebe confirms she left in the Ys and searches her purse for something else.
Phoebe hands Lizzie an envelope containing money and a football phone.
Lizzie opens the envelope and realizes it contains money.
Lizzie questions Phoebe about her intentions with the money.
Lizzie offers Phoebe her tin-foil hat as a gift.
Phoebe declines Lizzie's offer and explains she needs the hat.
Lizzie insists on doing something for Phoebe and offers to buy her a soda.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Street, Phoebe and Lizzie are at a hot dog vendor.]

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: Keep the change. (To Phoebe) Sure you don't wanna pretzel?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I'm fine.

dialogue.speaker: LIZZIE
dialogue.text: (leaves) See ya.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Huh!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Street, Phoebe and Lizzie are at a hot dog vendor.]

events.event_description: Lizzie hands money to the hot dog vendor and receives a hot dog in exchange.
Lizzie offers Phoebe a pretzel and asks if she wants one.
Phoebe declines the pretzel and responds that she is fine.
Lizzie leaves the scene after saying goodbye to Phoebe.
Phoebe reacts with a
Lizzie walks away from Phoebe and the hot dog vendor.
Phoebe remains standing at the scene after Lizzie leaves.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is telling everyone about her discovery.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: A thumb ?!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Eww!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know! I know, I opened it up and there it was, just floating in there, like this tiny little hitch-hiker!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, maybe it's a contest, y'know? Like, collect all five?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Does, um, anyone wanna see?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Nooo!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, hey, don't do that! Cut it out!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: It's worse than the thumb!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, this is so unfair!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, why is it unfair?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So I have a flaw! Big deal! Like Joey's constant knuckle-cracking isn't annoying? And Ross, with his over-pronouncing every single word? And Monica, with that snort when she laughs? I mean, what the hell is that thing? ...I accept all those flaws, why can't you accept me for this?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ...Does the knuckle-cracking bother everybody?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I-I could live without it.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, is it, like, a little annoying, or is it like when Phoebe chews her hair?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, now, don't listen to him, Pheebs, I think it's endearing.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, (Imitating Ross) "you do, do you"?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You know, there's nothing wrong with speaking correctly.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: "Indeed there isn't"... I should really get back to work.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, 'cause otherwise someone might get what they actually ordered.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohh-ho-hooohhh. The hair comes out, and the gloves come on.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is telling everyone about her discovery.]

events.event_description: Phoebe announces to the group that she discovered a floating thumb in her discovery.
Ross reacts with surprise and exclaims, 'A thumb?!'
The group collectively reacts with disgust, saying 'Eww!'
Phoebe describes opening the thumb and finding it floating like a tiny hitch-hiker.
Chandler suggests that the thumb might be part of a contest to collect all five.
Phoebe offers to show the thumb to the group, who collectively refuse.
Chandler complains about the unfairness of a flaw, comparing it to other characters' annoying habits.
Joey asks if his knuckle-cracking bothers everyone, seeking validation.
Rachel comments that she could live without Joey's knuckle-cracking and mentions returning to work.
Rachel humorously remarks about her hair coming out and putting on gloves, implying she is about to leave or prepare for something.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Iridium, Monica and Paula are working.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did you ever go out with a guy your friends all really like?

dialogue.speaker: PAULA
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay.. Well, I'm going out with a guy my friends all really like.

dialogue.speaker: PAULA
dialogue.text: Waitwait.. we talking about the coyotes here? All right, a cow got through!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Can you believe it? ...Y'know what? I just don't feel the thing . I mean, they feel the thing, I don't feel the thing.

dialogue.speaker: PAULA
dialogue.text: Honey.. you should always feel the thing . Listen, if that's how you feel about the guy, Monica, dump him!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know.. it's gonna be really hard.

dialogue.speaker: PAULA
dialogue.text: Well, he's a big boy, he'll get over it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, he'll be fine. It's the other five I'm worried about.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Iridium, Monica and Paula are working.]

events.event_description: Monica asks Paula if she has ever dated a guy her friends all like.
Paula responds that she has not gone out with such a guy.
Monica reveals she is going out with a guy her friends all like.
Paula questions if they are talking about the coyotes, and mentions a cow getting through.
Monica expresses disbelief and states she doesn't feel the connection with the guy.
Paula advises Monica to always feel the connection and suggests she should dump the guy if she doesn't feel it.
Monica admits that it will be really hard to end the relationship.
Paula reassures Monica that the guy will get over it.
Monica expresses concern about the other five people involved.
Paula encourages Monica to follow her feelings and suggests ending the relationship.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Cental Perk, Joey and Ross are persecuting Chandler about his smoking.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Do you have any respect for your body?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Don't you realise what you're-you're doing to yourself?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, y'know, I have had it with you guys and your cancer and your emphysema and your heart disease. The bottom line is, smoking is cool, and you know it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (holding the phone out to Chandler) Chandler? It's Alan, he wants to speak to you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Really? He does? (taking the phone) Hey, buddy, what's up! Oh, she told you about that, huh. Well, yeah, I have one now and then. Well, yeah, now. Well, it's not that big- ..well, that's true,.. Gee, y'know, no-one- no-one's ever put it like that before. Well, okay, thanks! (He hands the phone back and stubs out his cigarette.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Ross, who has wandered up) God, he's good.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: If only he were a woman.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Cental Perk, Joey and Ross are persecuting Chandler about his smoking.]

events.event_description: Joey questions Chandler about his respect for his body.
Ross confronts Chandler about the health risks of smoking.
Chandler dismisses concerns, claims smoking is cool, and mentions health issues humorously.
Rachel offers Chandler the phone to speak with Alan, who wants to talk to him.
Chandler takes the phone and has a conversation with Alan about his smoking habit.
Chandler hands the phone back to Rachel after the call.
Chandler stubs out his cigarette after the phone call.
Rachel comments on Chandler's ability to handle the situation well.
Ross comments on Chandler's skills, wishing he were a woman.
Rachel agrees with Ross's comment about Chandler.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyond except Monica and Joey is watching Lambchop.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooh, Lambchop. How old is that sock? If I had a sock on my hand for thirty years it'd be talking too.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. I think it's time to change somebody's nicotine patch. (Does so.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey. Where's Joey?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joey ate my last stick of gum, so I killed him. Do you think that was wrong?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I think he's across the hall.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thanks. (Goes to fetch him.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (finishing changing Chandler's nicotine patch) There y'go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (deadpan) Ooh, I'm alive with pleasure now.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey Pheebs, you gonna have the rest of that Pop-Tart?.. Pheebs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Does anyone want the rest of this Pop-Tart?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, I might!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Sorry. ..Y'know, those stupid soda people gave me seven thousand dollars for the thumb.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: You're kidding. Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: And on my way over here, I stepped in gum. ...What is up with the universe?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (dragged in by Monica, he has just gotten out of the shower) What's going on?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Nothing. I just think it's nice when we're all here together.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Even nicer when everyone gets to wear their underwear..

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, Joey..

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, God! (Hurriedly closes his legs.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (turns off the TV) Okay..

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh! That was Lambchop!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Please, guys, we have to talk.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, I'm getting a deja vu ...no, I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright, we have to talk.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: There it is!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay. It's-it's about Alan. There's something that you should know. I mean, there's really no easy way to say this.. uh.. I've decided to break up with Alan.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is there somebody else?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, nononono.. it's just.. things change. People change.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We didn't change..

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So that's it? It's over? Just like that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You know.. you let your guard down, you start to really care about someone, and I just- I- (starts chewing her hair)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look, I- I could go on pretending-

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: -but that wouldn't be fair to me, it wouldn't be fair to Alan- It wouldn't be fair to you!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Who-who wants fair? Y'know, I just want things back. Y'know, the way they were.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry..

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Oh, she's sorry! I feel better!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (tearful) I just can't believe this! I mean, with the holidays coming up- I wanted him to meet my family-

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'll meet somone else. There'll be other Alans.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah! Right!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are you guys gonna be okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey hey, we'll be fine. We're just gonna need a little time.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (dubious) I understand.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyond except Monica and Joey is watching Lambchop.]

events.event_description: Chandler comments on Lambchop's age and jokes about having a sock on his hand for thirty years.
Ross indicates it's time to change someone's nicotine patch and does so.
Monica enters and asks about Joey's whereabouts.
Chandler sarcastically questions whether killing Joey for eating his gum was wrong.
Rachel informs Monica that Joey is across the hall.
Monica goes to fetch Joey.
Phoebe offers the rest of her Pop-Tart to others.
Phoebe shares that she received seven thousand dollars for her thumb from soda people and laments about stepping in gum.
Monica announces she needs to talk about Alan and reveals she has decided to break up with him.
Monica explains to the group that she is ending her relationship with Alan because things and people change.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Restaurant, Monica is breaking the news to Alan.]

dialogue.speaker: ALAN
dialogue.text: Wow.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm, I'm really sorry.

dialogue.speaker: ALAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm sorry too. But, I gotta tell you, I am a little relieved.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Relieved?

dialogue.speaker: ALAN
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, I had a great time with you.. I just can't stand your friends.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Restaurant, Monica is breaking the news to Alan.]

events.event_description: Monica begins to break the news to Alan about their relationship or situation.
Alan reacts with surprise or curiosity upon hearing Monica's news.
Monica apologizes to Alan for the situation.
Alan responds by expressing mutual apology and admits feeling relieved.
Alan explains that he had a good time with Monica but dislikes her friends.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is mopping around and eating ice cream.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Remember when we went to Central Park and rented boats?.. That was fun.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. He could row like a viking.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Mmm.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So how'd it go?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, y'know..

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Did he mention us?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He said he's really gonna miss you guys. (dubious look)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You had a rough day, huh.. c'mere. (She sits down and Ross strokes her forehead.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...That's it. I'm getting cigarettes.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: No no no!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (leaving) I don't care, I don't care! Game's over! I'm weak! I've gotta smoke! I've gotta have the smoke!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (shouting as he leaves) If you never smoke again I'll give you seven thousand dollars!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (returns) Yeah, alright.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is mopping around and eating ice cream.]

events.event_description: Rachel reminisces about renting boats in Central Park and describes it as fun.
Ross comments that the person could row like a viking.
Monica enters the scene and greets everyone.
Ross asks Monica how her day went.
Monica responds that her day was okay.
Phoebe asks if Monica's date mentioned them.
Monica says her date said he would miss the group.
Ross comforts Monica by sitting beside her and stroking her forehead.
Chandler announces he is going to get cigarettes and leaves the scene.
Phoebe offers Chandler seven thousand dollars if he never smokes again, prompting his return.
